Uses of Class
Model.Terrain.AbstractTerrain

  • Packages that use AbstractTerrain 
    Package Description
    Model.Agent  
    Model.Game  
    Model.Terrain  

    • Uses of AbstractTerrain in Model.Agent

      Methods in Model.Agent with parameters of type AbstractTerrain 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      FightStatus Agent.actionTurn(AbstractTerrain terrain, java.util.LinkedList<Agent> enemyTeam, java.util.LinkedList<Agent> alliedTeam)
      Turn of an agent : Find a place to move to attack an enemy The agent can either be at range of one or more enemies at the start of his turn and will focus the one he has more chance to win against Or he will try to find the 5 closest enemies and focus the fight he has more chance to win against
      protected java.util.List<Agent> Knight.findBestTargets(java.util.List<Agent> targets, AbstractTerrain terrain)
      Find the best target to attack As a Knight, the Agent wants to attack in priority AxeMen Agents because it has an advantage or BowMen that can't counter attack If no AxeMen Agents can be targeted, look for other Knight Agents If no other targets found, return the initial target list
      protected java.util.List<Agent> BowMan.findBestTargets(java.util.List<Agent> targets, AbstractTerrain terrain)
      Find the best target to attack As a BowMan, the Agent wants to attack in priority Melee Agents so he does not get counter attacked If no melee agents can be targeted, returns the initial targets
      protected abstract java.util.List<Agent> RangedAgent.findBestTargets(java.util.List<Agent> targets, AbstractTerrain terrain) 
      protected java.util.List<Agent> Lancer.findBestTargets(java.util.List<Agent> targets, AbstractTerrain terrain)
      Find the best target to attack As a Lancer, the Agent wants to attack in priority Knight Agents because it has an advantage or BowMen that can't counter attack If no Knight Agents can be targeted, look for other Lancer Agents If no other targets found, return the initial target list
      protected java.util.List<Agent> AxeMan.findBestTargets(java.util.List<Agent> targets, AbstractTerrain terrain)
      Find the best target to attack As an AxeMan, the Agent wants to attack in priority Lancer Agents because it has an advantage or BowMen that can't counter attack If no Lancer Agents can be targeted, look for other AxeMen Agents If no other targets found, return the initial target list
      protected abstract java.util.List<Agent> MeleeAgent.findBestTargets(java.util.List<Agent> targets, AbstractTerrain terrain) 
      protected abstract java.util.List<Agent> Agent.findBestTargets(java.util.List<Agent> targets, AbstractTerrain terrain) 
      protected java.util.List<Agent> RangedAgent.findEnemiesAtRange(AbstractTerrain terrain, java.util.List<Agent> enemyTeam)
      Find all enemies at range (distance between enemy and agent = 2)
      protected java.util.List<Agent> MeleeAgent.findEnemiesAtRange(AbstractTerrain terrain, java.util.List<Agent> enemyTeam)
      Find all enemies at range (distance between enemy and agent = 1)
      protected abstract java.util.List<Agent> Agent.findEnemiesAtRange(AbstractTerrain terrain, java.util.List<Agent> enemyTeam) 
      protected boolean Agent.moveTo(AbstractTerrain terrain, int posX, int posY)
      Move an agent to the said coordinates on the terrain if the position is free of any agent
